1
CASSAVA: This lone plant left by the expedition team appears to be completely unaffected by the presence of the deadly matter around it.
2 1
CASSAVA: Beyond it, the trees, grasses, and flora of the star system appear bizzarely resilient to the deadly matter, despite its terrible effect on the star system.
3 2
CASSAVA: I can only assume the differences between the biology of plants and animals must have protected them.. But was this survival by miraculous chance, or engineered specificity?
4 3
CASSAVA: The bramble appears to be strong and healthy, even as it is engulfed by the deadly matter.. That can be no coincidence in my mind.
5 4
CASSAVA: Our clan had long wondered if the bramble was a conduit of intergalactic travel for a more advanced civilization's intergalactic travel.
6 4
CASSAVA: If this is true.. Did they detect us, and perceive us as threats? Was this comet sent to deliberately purge the star system the bramble had taken root in?
7 4
CASSAVA: ...I must continue this investigation. Until I can answer this question, my journey has not come to an end.
